title: Almost perfect
comment: Seemed to report inaccurate connection status. I do love that you can show the MAC address of the WAP and of course the IP address pulled.

title: Still has problems.
comment: Nexus 4. It never notifies me when both Mobile and WiFi connections are gone. The messages could be clearer. When I leave home and lose my wifi connection, the notification is that mobile data is now enabled  I would love to see a desc of when not if is triggered.  I just enabled preference to show alt icon when wifi is lost and several times it has changed to that icon and notified me wifi is lost even though it is not. Opening app puts back the correct 'connected' icon.

title: ☆☆☆☆It's pretty good.☆☆☆☆
comment: But there is a couple issues. You can't keep app sound working when you disable notification icon, you also can't keep sound notification on an change pull down notification to display bssid, or ip...so it just has to be basic the more you change in setting the less it might work. I am using a Samsung galaxy s5 ...will be trying on note 4 next. Over all i like the app an can live with these inprefections..still worth ☆☆☆☆..!!¡¡!!..

title: Excellent App.
comment: Great app for getting notifications about type of current data connection. Please add few notification sounds for Wi-Fi, Mobile Data connections/disconnections.
It made my life somewhat simpler I tell u what.

title: Good. Good....Solve All my Problem.
comment: I Lost My Wifi outgoing Notification . This SOFTWARE HELP ME restore back .GooD....

title: Annoying beyond reason
comment: I had this app for a few weeks and I was driving me nuts.  No matter what I did with the settings, I would always get constant,  and frequent notifications that I was off my wifi, even when I had wifi off.  Yuck.

title: Perfect - solved my problem
comment: I was missing an ongoing notification screen WiFi connection status on my Samsung Galaxy Note 4. This app restored that capability.
Very usefull

title: Great replacement for feature which was removed in the Galaxy S 5
comment: It is a simple but very useful app which does exactly what it says it will: puts a wifi notification and quick access point in your notification menu.  At the moment the app warrants 4.5 stars, so I rounded up to 5. With one or two small changes, it will be a fulL 5 star app :).  SUGGESTIONS TO DEVELOPER:  1. Config option to remove the status icon. 2. It would be useful to be able to see the top-level IP as well as the local IP. 3.  Also would be nice to see the link speed in the notification bar

Thank you. for you suggestions:
1. This is long wanted feature that is possible only from android 4.1. It's implemented in the new v1.8 (which is currently in beta).
2+3. I've added that to the TODO list.

title: GOD BLESS YOU VERY GOOD WORK

comment: Thank you!

title: Sorry :-[
comment: It's not even letting me get on the internet, even tho I am connected via Wi-Fi.... Don't no what's up with this but sure would like it if it did work cuz I live off of my Wi-Fi....

title: Basho
comment: Ub

title: Not updating status correctly
comment: This is an app which really need, but it doesn't seem to be working entirely correctly. It will often not update the status to indicate a WiFi connection, but instead will continue to say, "Mobile" for the connection (when I know i'm on WiFi). Not very useful if it doesn't update properly and timely.

title: Handy!
comment: Very handy

title: Useful app
comment: The size of the font needs to be bigger.  Remove "connected via wifi" it just a waste of space. I already know I'm on Wi-Fi from the android icon

title: Great except for light
comment: This app is very useful for seeing my IP at a glance. However, the fact that it turns the notification light every time I connect may ultimately make me uninstall it.
Fixed on 1.6.1+

title: Excellent
comment: sound plays important role.

title: LED on/off
comment: Good app works perfect on my s3. But there should be setting to control LED on/off on notification. For me just the sound notification is enough.
Fixed on 1.6.1+

title: Steve
comment: just one word "excellent "

title: Perfect
comment: Simple and does exactly what it needs to do.
